Articles.Content:
Hello. So, Jeb is getting lazy recently. in his dunar base, he now wants to fly on a small (no command pods, only clinging on a ladder) vessel powered by RCS. So, you can build him one!

rules:

no manned command modules used in the vehicle

must use RCS or Jet (air) engines to fly

Must be stock (mechjeb is ok)

Must be able to hover and maneuver.

Must be refuelable and able to land.

Must have a light used to explore at night.

Must have solar panels

Must not be able to glide (so no gliders, no planes)

IMPORTANT: MUST BE ABLE TO FLY ON DUNA AND MUST HAVE A SCREENSHOT OF THE VESSEL HOVERING ON DUNA!!!!!!(cuz jeb is on duna, dummy) ALSO MUST GIVE .CRAFT FILE

Good Luck!(i can't enter my challenge because i am too busy! sorry:P)

Edited May 9, 2013 by dennislinux
forgot to put one of the important rules in
Jet on Duna? I thought only Kerbin and Laythe had oxigen...
Please read the rules before you post a challenge. Also, Atanar, Laythe, Jool, Duna, Eve and Kerbin are the only planets with an atmosphere, oxygen is irrelevant
You can't use jet engines in Duna... It has no oxygen.
You can use Jet Engines in Duna...
I think he wants us to use RCS to fly.
It does say RCS *OR* jet engines. You don't have to use the jet engines
But he mentioned them! Just kidding, But hovering with RCS now is very hard. :/

You can use Jet Engines in Duna...

May have been the case before 0.18, but not anymore. Laythe or Kerbin, that's it. I think they'll make noise and use fuel on Eve and probably Duna, but they won't provide thrust.
it is not a must to use jet engines.

The landing was terrible, but the hovercraft worker as expected!

I forgot to put docking ports on it, so im not able to refuel it...

Kerbal flying of the ladder

he survived
cool. you are now the first place in the competition

Also, Atanar, Laythe, Jool, Duna, Eve and Kerbin are the only planets with an atmosphere, oxygen is irrelevant

Atanar... wat

Atanar... wat

That's me, I am also a planet sometimes.

dat misleading comma

well I'm glad to hear that! I would use it as a name for a yet to be added gas giant btw
